Package Client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OthelloClient, java.lang.Runnable
    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements OthelloClient, java.lang.Runnable

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Client()
      Constructor when first created that initializes: socket to be null for later creation a new TUI object to receive System.in and print System.out

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Disconnect from server by closing the socket as well as the buffered writer
      void commandHandle​(java.lang.String input)
      This method will handle the commands that the server receives from the client.
      boolean connect​(java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of a client connecting to a specific port of server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false Finally, this method will initialize BufferedReader and BufferedWriter based on the recent created socket
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Get the username of the player
      void handleGameOver​(java.lang.String message)
      This method handles GAMEOVER command sent by server that the client receives It prints out who the winner is and what the reason of victory, then print out the menu for player to choose again
      void handleHello()
      This method shows how to process if Client receives back HELLO protocol from server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error
      void handleList​(java.lang.String message)
      This method is to handle when client receives LIST command from server It should print out to the console a list of usernames that are currently logged into the server
      void handleLogin()
      This method shows how to process if Client receives back LOGIN protocol from server which is storing this client to a list for future using and printing out the menu
      void handleMove​(java.lang.String input)
      This method handles MOVE commands sent by server that the client receives
      void handleNewGame​(java.lang.String input)
      This method handles when the client receives NEWGAME protocol from the server The method starts handling the first move for both players, where one will place the Mark and the other will be in waiting state.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      void printMenu()
      This method is to print out the menu with options to be chosen Option 1: Send the LIST protocol to the server -> to receive a list of act Option 2: Send the QUEUE protocol to the server -> player gets to the queue and wait for opponent Option 3: Print out the help menu that displays options to choose Option 4: Quit by simply closing the socket
      void run()
      Start thread with a client object
      void sendError​(java.lang.String message)
      Send error to the server by indicating specific message for that error In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
      void sendHelloCommand()
      Send HELLO command from the client to server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket
      boolean sendListCommand()
      This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the LIST protocol from the client to server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
      boolean sendMoveCommand​(int index)
      This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the protocol MOVE to the server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
      boolean sendQueueCommand()
      This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the protocol QUEUE to the server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                       int port)
                throws java.io.IOException
        This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of a client connecting to a specific port of server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false Finally, this method will initialize BufferedReader and BufferedWriter based on the recent created socket
        Specified by:
        connect in interface OthelloClient
        Parameters:
        address - , which is the IP address of the server
        port - , which is the port that you want to connect to
        Returns:
        true if successfully connected; else false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Get the username of the player
        Returns:
        player's username

      • close

        public void close()
        Disconnect from server by closing the socket as well as the buffered writer
        Specified by:
        close in interface OthelloClient

      • sendHelloCommand

        public void sendHelloCommand()
        Send HELLO command from the client to server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket

      • handleHello

        public void handleHello()
        This method shows how to process if Client receives back HELLO protocol from server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error

      • printMenu

        public void printMenu()
        This method is to print out the menu with options to be chosen Option 1: Send the LIST protocol to the server -> to receive a list of act Option 2: Send the QUEUE protocol to the server -> player gets to the queue and wait for opponent Option 3: Print out the help menu that displays options to choose Option 4: Quit by simply closing the socket

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin()
        This method shows how to process if Client receives back LOGIN protocol from server which is storing this client to a list for future using and printing out the menu

      • sendListCommand

        public boolean sendListCommand()
        This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the LIST protocol from the client to server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
        Returns:
        true if no errors were found; else false

      • sendQueueCommand

        public boolean sendQueueCommand()
        This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the protocol QUEUE to the server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
        Returns:
        true if QUEUE command was sent successfully; else false

      • handleList

        public void handleList​(java.lang.String message)
        This method is to handle when client receives LIST command from server It should print out to the console a list of usernames that are currently logged into the server
        Parameters:
        message - , which is a list name of active users

      • sendError

        public void sendError​(java.lang.String message)
        Send error to the server by indicating specific message for that error In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
        Parameters:
        message - , which is the error specification

      • sendMoveCommand

        public boolean sendMoveCommand​(int index)
        This boolean method should return true on success or false on failure, in terms of sending the protocol MOVE to the server In case an exception is thrown, then print out the message indicating the error, then close the socket and return false
        Parameters:
        index - , the index that player wants to send
        Returns:
        true if MOVE is sent successfully; else false

      • handleNewGame

        public void handleNewGame​(java.lang.String input)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method handles when the client receives NEWGAME protocol from the server The method starts handling the first move for both players, where one will place the Mark and the other will be in waiting state. Then, it sends MOVE to the server, the server sends MOVE back and client continues using that MOVE for the other player
        Parameters:
        input - , which is the NEWGAME protocol sent by the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • handleMove

        public void handleMove​(java.lang.String input)
        This method handles MOVE commands sent by server that the client receives
        Parameters:
        input - , which is the MOVE protocol sent by the server

      • handleGameOver

        public void handleGameOver​(java.lang.String message)
        This method handles GAMEOVER command sent by server that the client receives It prints out who the winner is and what the reason of victory, then print out the menu for player to choose again
        Parameters:
        message - , which is the GAMEOVER protocol sent by the server

      • commandHandle

        public void commandHandle​(java.lang.String input)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will handle the commands that the server receives from the client. The client receives a string (which is the protocol sent from server) and then based on the first word of protocol can the method classifies into different cases
        Parameters:
        input - , which is the protocol received from the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
